statement.tex:
$A, B$ and $C$ are three trains on three separate tracks (see figure). $T_2\parallel T_3$ and $T_1\perp$ to both $T_2$ and $T_3$. Train $A$ has developed engine trouble and is therefore being towards $M$ by $B$ using an iron-chain welded to the two trains. But when $B$ is 30 meters from $N$ (and 40 meters from $N$), it too develops engine trouble. So now, train $B$ is attached to train $C$ and is pulled towards $N$. If $C$ is moving at 3 m/s and the two chains ($AB$ and $BC$) are 50 m. long, \underline{then how fast is $A$ moving}?
\begin{center} \includegraphics[scale=1.8]{333-A.svg} \end{center}
